Holiday Money Get in touch Book a video call Make an enquiry Call 0800 713 715 Help Get in touch Back View gallery / Back Rocky Mountaineer Rocky Mountaineer - Sliverleaf Rocky Mountaineer - Gold Class Banff Canada First Passage to the West Classic Banff with Rocky Mountaineer Rail Travel • Sightseeing Overview Inclusions Terms & Conditions Step back in time on the legendary route that opened the Canadian Rockies to the world. Journey from Vancouver to Banff aboard Rocky Mountaineer’s classic daytime rail experience, winding through towering mountains, emerald lakes, and iconic landmarks like Spiral Tunnels and Glacier National Park. This unforgettable journey blends history, stunning landscapes, and luxury travel, delivering a front-row seat to Canada’s wild and majestic West. GoldLeaf Service Indulge in luxury aboard the bi-level GoldLeaf dome coach, featuring panoramic glass ceilings for unbeatable views. Enjoy gourmet meals served in an elegant dining room, sip complimentary beverages, and relax on the outdoor viewing platform—all while receiving personalized service from your dedicated hosts. GoldLeaf turns your rail journey into a first-class experience. SilverLeaf Service Experience comfort and stunning scenery in SilverLeaf’s single-level dome coaches with oversized windows. Savour delicious hot meals served right at your seat, enjoy complimentary beverages and snacks, and benefit from attentive onboard hosts who bring the landscape to life with stories and insights. SilverLeaf offers a perfect blend of value and charm for your Rocky Mountaineer adventure. View more View less rail travel & sightseeing Contact us for the best price available Enquire now Sale Period : until sold out Your inclusions 2 days Rocky Mountaineer SilverLeaf or GoldLeaf Service 2 nights hotel in Vancouver 1 night hotel in Kamloops 2 nights hotel in Banff 2 breakfast, 2 lunches on board Rocky Mountaineer National Parks Pass Luggage handling and rail station transfers in Vancouver, Kamloops and Banff Travel Rocky Mountaineer offers a variety of tours with flexible durations - customise this itinerary to create your perfect, personalised holiday experience. NOTE: These itineraries below can be done in either direction Contact your House of Travel Consultant for the best price available for your travel dates Your itinerary Day 1: Vancouver Arrive in Vancouver and spend time exploring this scenic coastal city on your own. That could be discovering Stanley Park, taking a small ferry to Granville Island, or much more. Overnight in Vancouver. Day 2: Vancouver Enjoy the day with free time to relax or book your own activities at your leisure. Vancouver has activities for all interests, including visiting historic Gastown, dining in lively Yaletown, or enjoying a walk on the Stanley Park Seawall. No matter what you choose to do, the Coast Mountains and the Pacific Ocean surround you. Overnight in Vancouver. Day 3: Vancouver to Kamloops Departing early in the morning, travel onboard Rocky Mountaineer from the coastal city of Vancouver to Kamloops, located in the heart of British Columbia's interior. On today's journey, you will see dramatic changes in scenery, from the lush green fields of the Fraser Valley, through forests and winding river canyons surrounded by the peaks of the Coast and Cascade Mountains, to the desert-like landscapes of the BC interior. Highlights include the rushing waters of Hell's Gate in the Fraser Canyon and the steep slopes and rock sheds along the Thompson River. Your day ends in the evening as the train travels along the shores of Kamloops Lake into the town of Kamloops. Overnight in Kamloops. B, L. Day 4: Kamloops to Banff Early in the morning, your journey continues eastward to the mighty Canadian Rockies and the province of Alberta. Once again, you will experience ever-changing scenery as you travel across ranchlands, along rocky lakeshores, over high mountain passes and through the remarkable tunnels that form part of the rich rail history of the Canadian Rockies. Today's highlights include Craigellachie, where the last spike of the Canadian Pacific Railway was driven, the climb over Rogers Pass, Kicking Horse Canyon, the Spiral Tunnels and, of course, the iconic glaciers and snow-capped peaks of the Canadian Rockies. Your rail journey ends this evening in the resort town of Banff. Overnight in Banff. B, L. Day 5: Banff Enjoy the day with free time to relax or book your own activities at your leisure. Banff has activities for all, from taking the gondola to the top of Sulphur Mountain, relaxing in the Banff hot springs, exploring the bustling town, to outdoor wildlife adventures. Overnight in Banff. Day 6: Banff Your journey ends upon checkout from your Banff hotel. Terms & Conditions Valid for new bookings until sold out • Prices are dynamic, providing best available rate of the day at the time of booking. Pricing is subject to availability at the time of booking confirmation and may change without notice. • Credit card fees will apply. • Airfares are not included and are an additional cost • City Taxes and fees are not included • Amendment and cancellation fees apply • Surcharges and closeout dates may apply • Please ask your House of Travel consultant for full terms and conditions.
